Class DisplayCanvasWireFrame 

java.lang.Object
   |
   +----java.awt.Component
           |
           +----java.awt.Canvas
                   |
                   +----DisplayCanvas
                           |
                           +----DisplayCanvasWireFrame
public class DisplayCanvasWireFrame
extends DisplayCanvas
DisplayCanvasWireFrame.java uses a 4 parameter viewing system to display wireframe images on a canvas. has static methods which are public for use in world transforms. this class is passed a DisplayFrameElement, it transforms the world points to screen Points, and calls the dfe's draw function, which understands the way to connect the points.

Version:
99.3.1
Author:
Brian Maltzan

DEGREETORADIAN

return new T3d[], transform points by mat.
do_matrix_tran_pt(T3d, TMatrix3d)
return new T3d, from points by mat.

transform from world to screen coordinates.

set viewing 'd'.

 protected final double DEGREETORADIAN

DisplayCanvasWireFrame 
 public DisplayCanvasWireFrame(Sim s,
                               String initial_string,
                               int display_instance)

draw 
 public void draw(DisplayFrameElement dfe)
transform from world to screen coordinates. call elements's draw method. draw's on the 2nd buffer.

Parameters:
dfe - one element of a frame's scene to draw.
set_view_pt 
 public void set_view_pt(T3d v)
set camera (x,y,z) location in world coordinates.

set_view_d 
 public void set_view_d(double d)
set viewing 'd'.

get_rotate3d_x_mat

rotate around x-axis.

Parameters:
angle - angle of rotation in radians.

                                            double phi,

coord_to_spherical 
 public static final T3d coord_to_spherical(T3d p)
convert point to rho, phi, theta. assume for origin of (0,0,0).

do_matrix_tran 
 public static final T3d[] do_matrix_tran(T3d points[],
                                          int n,
                                          TMatrix3d mat)
return new T3d[], transform points by mat.

do_matrix_tran_pt 
 public static final T3d do_matrix_tran_pt(T3d points,
                                           TMatrix3d mat)
return new T3d, from points by mat.
